channel.title: Comments on: April to Lose “Cruelest Month” Title

item.title: By: Moleman
item.dc:creator: Moleman
item.description:
Twisting Nether never queues up, even though it's listed as full, but does get brutal server-wide lag spikes during prime time. Rexxar, the new realm my PVE characters reside on, has some queues despite being listed as low population.
My guess is that there's some sort of demographic difference that explains this- PVP and PVE servers may run differently in terms of characters logged on vs characters created on server.
item.content:encoded:
Twisting Nether never queues up, even though it’s listed as full, but does get brutal server-wide lag spikes during prime time. Rexxar, the new realm my PVE characters reside on, has some queues despite being listed as low population.

My guess is that there’s some sort of demographic difference that explains this- PVP and PVE servers may run differently in terms of characters logged on vs characters created on server.

item.title: By: TheeNickster
item.dc:creator: TheeNickster
item.description: My last login was nearly a month ago. Back then, Bloodhoof had short queues, even on weekends. By short I mean less than 100 on weeknights, and 200 on weekends...
item.content:encoded: My last login was nearly a month ago. Back then, Bloodhoof had short queues, even on weekends. By short I mean less than 100 on weeknights, and 200 on weekends…

item.title: By: Hyd
item.dc:creator: Hyd
item.description: I've never had to queue up when logging on to Chromaggus. Terenas is usually 200 or so midevening, midweek.
item.content:encoded: I’ve never had to queue up when logging on to Chromaggus. Terenas is usually 200 or so midevening, midweek.
